text:
thanks all.  i’ve talked with rob a bit and am excited for y’all to kick off with client today!  though i'm bummed i’m not in the room with ya.  

this is a good outline but considering we’re going through a lot in a short period of time, I think it’d be good to mention our goals for the meeting upfront before we dive in on artifacts.  we can also mention that they’ll have some time to digest following the meeting.  we’ll reinforce these goals and next steps and the meeting’s conclusion.  

go get em.
thanks dennis, good points
Good call Dza :sunglasses:
<@U0HP6TFNX>: <@U0EL0GLEL> <@U02F9CXTL> can you all share your files for this PM in here and so I can get them in a place in Drive? Thanks!
<@U0B9N0HF0> Google slides?
Yes plz

I think dennis already added my files to drive, with the possible exception of this <https://docs.google.com/a/uncorkedstudios.com/document/d/1gW6Up7Iqyzz5mjTFF33QY85jl6PO0Yh6789rHjHKmQU/edit?usp=sharing>
<@U0HP6TFNX|megan> shared a file: <https://uncorked.slack.com/files/megan/F3L7Z4ZA4/google_net_contributor_content_criteria|Google Net Contributor Content Criteria>
all my files should have been added already
<@U02F9CXTL> I hope it doesn't mess you up if I add some of my content directly to the slides deck. let me know if it does and we can do something different
Thanks all
<@U0HP6TFNX> Not all all!

Goals
I. A clear understanding of the design and software approach
II. Confirm content structure
III. Definition of gold spike 
IV. Establish project meeting/discussion days/times
V. Discuss and confirm on-site playtest date

Adding to the Calendar invite and you can also find these on the kickoff doc ft. the agenda Megan shared yesterday <https://docs.google.com/a/uncorkedstudios.com/document/d/1xsjCKLfiSY2tQsrClD3r3Dth_Eg1DflJNe3heXP-Mqc/edit?usp=sharing>
<@U0B9N0HF0|rob> shared a file: <https://uncorked.slack.com/files/rob/F3NGTBKAT/_net_contributor__kick_off|[Net Contributor] Kick Off>
I'm planning on attending just to stay in loop if there's no opposition from the group
of course not
related - we’ll need to leave the Dir/Exec meeting early for this one
yep
already noted to team

Apologies in advance for the drop in and drop out communication. I only have a minute though. <@U0B9N0HF0> gold spike is defined in the sow. What do we hope to gain from discussing? Reinforcing what we already articulated? 

For points one and two it's not just about us conveying but creating a shared understanding and creating a point of departure by them approving/accepting. Right?
<!channel> Deck folks - would love to have everything in by 12:45 or earlier - that way i can reformat the text and clean everything up. Let me know when GOLDEN.
@pbliss <@U0HP6TFNX> Are we planning on addressing file guidelines (formats, upload vs. pull, etc.) in this presentation?
dont think we have outlined those yet
Yep. Just wanted to make sure if that question comes up we have a uniformed response
Since, when I move through the presentation, the "where does this content come from?" is the first question that comes to mind. Should be prepared.

there might be a mix of upload vs pull, some of the data might be iframed from another site. but when there is things like images, i would think we would want them local to our system. treat our server like a staging environment as much as possible. keep it self contained if possible, so prevent a 404 of some content removal

we will have google storage, and able to upload media to it. so we are setup for that. I would steer towards the data is staged / uploaded. but that might be more to manage / more for the person setting up this content to do, ie they need to download then upload the content to our server. vs just link to it.
Thanks. If the question comes up, I think that's a good explanation for why we want to further explore the matter

some content could be setup to snarf off a server and pull local auto. if they had the url to an image, we could setup the admin to do that request and pull it over so we keep a copy of it local. not sure if that is the scope we are committed to tho
Framed question of: quality control vs. ease of use

yeah certainly, ideally the content is all on our server, we treat it like a staging point. the internet could be shut off an the thing still runs fine, well it would still need to talk to the google app engine, but if it was isolated beyond that its still solid. keeping things under our control. but that brings in the extra management concerns, as well as cost of storage, management of the assets on the server can become more too, for simplicity we just keep them linked to the content they originated with, and remove when that one is.
I'm finished stubbing in the content section <@U02F9CXTL>
pages 9-15
do you want to take a look and see if you have any questions before I get pulled into this meeting at noon?
Something for Compass came up so I will not be able to join the meeting. Let me know if there’s any prep I can help with beforehand

<@U0B9N0HF0>  Let me know when your in a good spot so i can reformat the text.
Thanks!
Ok cool. I'd love some word smithing, but at this point, I think we're good :slightly_smiling_face:
Great work on the deck team. <@U02F9CXTL> =  he who can make G Slides attractive
Do we have a plan for slide #8? Right now it's blank
Or is that just a header/break?
I was putting in section slides to help with transitions
Ok thanks. Just checking.
on those transition pages, can we format them to look like title pages <@U02F9CXTL> ?
just so they don't think we forgot something
done
nice
<@U0B9N0HF0> - looking at slide 16 now. I’d like to make that a little more pointy and next-step-y
like - more directive
do we have a sense internally on where we are with the goldspike scope?
Yes

demonstration of functional
webapp, including paneled content or webpages,across monitors; UCS local to Exhibit production

Is the SOW language. What I want to bring up is excatly what that looks like: Uncorked Studios goes down there, is able to upload content into an admin and then display that content structured on the exhibiit
I want them agreeing to that. Deliverables that hide in document nobody ever references scare me
Please word smith how you like, but IMO, next steps hinge a great deal on the level of comprehension and approval of what we present today
haha
creepy
<@U02AUNA0P>
YES
no
<@U0EL0GLEL> Just confirming this is the client-friendly software approach doc? <https://docs.google.com/document/d/1AX5zfBCYg9zNjSw-zx8aNBfqgDc-Yxx0ds3_x1UT9Dc/edit>
<@U0B9N0HF0|rob> shared a file: <https://uncorked.slack.com/files/joel/F3G0GH0QG/net_contributor_-_software_implementation_plan|Net Contributor - Software Implementation Plan>
Looking to resolve the comments now. Do you have access to the renderings mentioned? Felix and the topology doc?
that is the doc yes
hmm, i think they are on drive somewhere
Cool. I can insert them. Guess was wondering if there was a reason they hadn't been put in yet?
Like a specific reason _not_ to include them
nope no reason like that
